title: Fresh
content:
This is cool, I know I’ve seen this “f” before...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [fresh(1).gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071013234204/http:/typophile.com/files/fresh(1).gif) | 27.26 KB |

 [‹ Tree Carved Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071013234204/http:/typophile.com/node/12081 "Go to previous forum topic") [southern star endemol ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071013234204/http:/typophile.com/node/12264 "Go to next forum topic")
author: adriano

comments.content: That’s not a typeface, that’s grass! :D

I’ve always had a soft spot for Monotype’s [Monoline Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20071013234204/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.264.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=fresh&sampleSize=144).

’Monoline Script’, or, ’ [Mandate](http://web.archive.org/web/20071013234204/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ludlow/mandate/)’, may be close..

_( Edit.: Nah, Yves beat me to it.. :)_

OK Does anybody know a good RSS feeder? This is getting nowhere. Gawd do I miss e-mail notification!

_And I’d better get used to using HTML-tags real quick, because my response time is down the drain. Is there a quick’n’easy tag for gray text?_

My favored OS X RSS Readers: NetNewsWire 2.0 (beta) and NewsFire.

The first is more feature-filled, the second simpler and beautiful.
